questions.text: A 30 year old male sustained injury to his left lower limb in an RTA . His X-ray showed transverse fracture of the femur. On examination, there is a wound of size 6cm and there is no soft tissue loss. However, the Femoral A is injured. What is the Gustilo Anderson grade?
Bone loss in Hill Sach's lesion is in which part of the humeral head?
Which nerve injury can occur in the fracture shown in the X ray?
A 20 year old man presents to the emergency department with history of RTA. He complains of pain in the right hip. His X ray is shown below. What is the diagnosis?
A 10 year old girl presents with pain in her left arm for the last 3 months. Her Xray is given below. What is the diagnosis?
A 20 year old male presents with pain of his left hip and limping, for the last 2 years. His X ray is given below. What is the diagnosis?
Which is not a part of Kanavel cardinal signs?
A 12 year old boy, presents with pain on the left hip. His weight was found to be 70kg. He is unable to walk and O/E left hip is externally rotated and adducted. What is the most probable diagnosis?
What is false about CTEV shoes?
A 3 year old child presents with lethargy and bow legs. Her wrist x ray is shown in the image. What is the diagnosis?
In which nerve injury is the splint shown in the image used?
A 35 year old male presented with neck pain and paraesthesia of right upper limb for 3 months. The test shown in the image is positive. What is the diagnosis?

A 25 year old man who regularly took steroid injections for building his physique, presents with pain of the left hip. X ray shows flattening of femoral head with crescent shaped area in the subchondral region. What is the diagnosis?
Identify the deformity shown in the figure.
A 30 year old male presents with back pain for the last 3 years. He has occasional episodes of red eye and his chest expansion is reduced. His X-ray is given below. What is the diagnosis?
Which is not a part of the terrible triad of elbow?

A 6-year-old child sustained supracondylar fracture of humerus which was treated using a plaster slab. However, after few hours, the child developed severe pain of the forearm, which was not relieved by analgesics. O/E, there was pain on passively extending her fingers but radial and ulnar pulses were present. What is the diagnosis?

Which test is used for the school screening of scoliosis?
What is Spina ventosa?

choices.text: There is proximal migration of midpoint of body
50 % of patients have impaired sexual development

questions.text: Not true about achondroplasia.

A 24 year old male presents with knee pain and difficulty in walking after injuring himself while playing football. On examination, the Dial test is positive. Which structure could have been injured?

Which of the following is not seen in osteogenesis imperfecta?
A 16 year old male presents with chronic osteomyelitis of humerus. His x ray is given below. Identify the marked structure.
A 12 year old child presents with a swelling of the right thigh. The swelling is painful and rapidly increasing in size. The x ray is given below. What is the probable diagnosis?
Which is the biochemical change seen in osteoporosis?
A 6 year old child is brought to the OPD with difficulty in shoulder abduction since birth. O/E he has a deformity of the shoulder as shown in the picture. What is the diagnosis?
A 54 year old man presents with history of RTA. He has sustained a fracture as shown in the x ray given below. Which nerve can be injured in association with this fracture?

A 7 year old child presents with swelling of her right thigh for the last 2 months. X ray shows a tumor arising from the diaphysis of femur and a biopsy shows round blue cells which are MIC 2 positive. What is the diagnosis?
Which is the most dangerous type of Odontoid fracture according to the Anderson D'Alonzo classification?
A 70 year old lady presents with fracture neck of femur after a fall. There is no history of osteoarthritis of the hip. Which is the ideal treatment for this lady?

choices.text: Nonunion of lateral condyle of humerus fracture

choices.text: Widening of intercondylar notch of femur

choices.text: Arteriogram of Brachial A and proceed as per findings
Closed reduction of the fracture, slab application and monitoring for reappearance of pulse

questions.text: A 6 year old child presents to the casualty with a type III supracondylar fracture of humerus. His radial and ulnar pulses are not palpable. However, his hand is pink and capillary filling is adequate. Next line of management is?

A 15 year old boy presented with pain over his right shoulder for the last 3 months. His x ray shows a lesion in the proximal humerus close to the shoulder joint. A biopsy from the lesion shows 'chicken wire' appearance. What is the probable diagnosis?
A 24 year old male presented to the OPD with history of TB hip. O/E there is flexion, adduction, internal rotation deformity and a true shortening of 3 cm. What stage is the TB hip in?

choices.text: High output cardiac failure may occur

questions.text: All are true regarding Paget's disease except

BMP injection at the fracture site

questions.text: A 18 year old boy presents with a 9 month old fracture of the shaft of right tibia, which was being treated by a local bone setter. However, the boy still has pain at the fracture site and is unable to walk. X ray shows nonunion with abundant callus formation. Best treatment for this condition is?
